ValueDomain.preferredName: Physical Examination Category Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A classification of physical examination data._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A classification of physical examination data.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was category of the phys
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was category of the physical examination?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor defined Controlled Terminology. The CRF can capture the different types of Physical Exams using PECAT (e.g. GENERAL, OPHTHAMOLOGIC, NEUROLOGICAL). This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PECAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PECAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the physical examination category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
